description: I've eaten here many times. Its the place we go to if we want good Chinese food and don't want to cheap out. I think its good and the place is usually packed so I don't think I'm alone. They even expanded into another section and still remain packed whenever we show up. Some of the dishes we've ordered are, Mu-shu pork, Salt and Pepper calamari (very good), Shrimp with Caramelized walnuts, Fried Rice, you know, the typical non-Chinese customers. We've always gotten high quality, and whenever we try something new, it's always excellent.
author: Rich M.

description: Good chicken and fish fried rice, bbq pork churng fun, and overall dim sum.  My husband and I enjoy our Chinese lunch.
author: Tanessa J.

description:
very good place in San Francisco. it is located in sunset district out on noriega (the second or third chinatown located in san francisco). We been here over a dozen times in the past month and i have to say, i did not get sick of it yet. all the food there on the menu have been satisfying. the waiters are all nice and provide very good service. i recommend people to come here and give it a try especially if you guys are traditional cantonese. The food is excellent. The sweet buns that they make for desert is something you can't find unless you go to hong kong. places like koi palace, R & G lounge, Mayflower, and big seafood restaurants can't beat the taste of this place. 

it i s located on the corner of 33rd end of the block from ABC restaurant and right across from a supermarket. give it a try, if it's not good, then come back and complain
author: Eric Y.

description: After a late night, came here with a group of friends for dim sum on Sunday. Had a good time, with a ton of food for cheap. Food was good, not great but definitely worth going for. I'll be honest, greasy dim sum was what I needed so everyone wins.
author: Mike C.

description:
i can't justify why people receive bad service here... but then again... i never have gotten bad service here so... i guess it was tough luck to those who gotten bad service... but at the same time... you're at a chinese restaurant... it's hussle and bussle... it aint no gary danko... 

as for food... i like it.  okay, wait... lemme go back... might i remind you that you are at a seafood restaurant... so my best advise is that it's a good idea to order seafood... and fresh seafood at that... walnut prawns do not count! (i've had their walnut prawns, and it's good, but i mean... i'd much prefer spending my $ on other dishes) ok, back to my review... food is always good here, at least on all the dishes that my family and i order... but we never order the ABC dishes... you know what i'm talking about?  i mean, we have... like we've had their lettuce cups... it's ok... broccoli beef... its ok... nothing compares to the regular dishes that we typically order... haha i know, i'm being cryptic... but ok... for example... we will always order the roasted squab... it's always good... skin is crispy... meat is juicy...yes squab is pigeon... is that freaky? but, it's good here... and you don't have to fly to HK to get good squab

so might i just add... ditch the ABC style... be open minded if you wanna eat good chinese food
author: Kelly H.

description:
The atmosphere was nice so we decided to go there for dinner.  The selection of seafood was good.  This is not a restaurant for kids, as it is on the expensive side and many of the food that you order for kids you could get down the street at a lot cheaper price.  The service there is TERRIBLE, unless you are regulars and know them as I notice the waiter talking with others they knew.  One thing I never experience was the waiter was so cheap when he scooped the soup into the bowls he said there was not enough and started to redistribute the rest of the bowls.  I thought that was TACKY and unprofessional.  Also, we had to ask them to get things multiple times.  I think they did not care because the tips were added to bill.  The food was so-so.  The crispy chicken was very dry.
As usual some bowls were not clean.  Norm for most of these restaurants, but not what I expected for this higher class more expensive  one (not worth it).

I would not go back to this place for dinner as the service was bad and it's not worth the price.
author: Albert W.

description: We don't eat in San Francisco that often.  Our friend took us there for dinner last week.  The food was very good.  However, the menu is as pricey as the restaurant in the south bay.  I kind of have a wrong impression that Chinese restaurants in the city should be cheaper than the south bay.  Well I don't mind paying more as long as the food is good.  However, I wonder how this restaurant compete with all the bargain restaurants nearby.  Perhaps good quality foods do stand out.  I don't mind eating there again when we are in town.
author: Joe L.

description: ok, so the best thing to do here, for dinner- tell the server- your choice, usually it ends up being something not on the menu which is fun and an adventure! we've done that a couple of times and it's been worth it. and sometimes the roommate wants dim sum for breakfast and bike up the road to this place, and always order too much, but it's solid. i have to mention... i haven't been here in..awhile..do to the fact that they were written up in the paper, as the worst (aka most unsanitary) in the CITY, the whole shabang. it creeped me out... but i got over it :)
author: Abigail W.

description:
My aunt held her 61st birthday dinner here. 2 members of our 10-top were running late and the manager comes to reprimand us! He kept coming around asking where they were, where they were coming from and asked us why we even bothered to make a reservation if the whole party wasn't here yet. It was a little rude of him, but we figured it might be because it was a busy night and there were other full tables eating, too. Lo and behold, we were the LAST big table they were serving AND we had already planned the menu beforehand so they knew what to make and stuff. Our last two members arrived 15 minutes later, so that was hardly late enough to deserve a tongue lashing, in my opinion. I thought it was kinda rude for the manager to come and scold us. 

The decor was OK, nothing super fancy. Food was above par, their shining moments being the Peking duck and the yellow chicken (not sure what it's called). Shark's fin soup was OK, had better. The abalone and vegetables only had a few pieces of low-quality canned, abalone and the rest were giant slices of mushrooms. We had a ten course meal and they ran out of the sweet soup, so they brought us a tray of assorted gelatin pudding, like coconut, red bean, and this other one I couldn't identify. Total came out to $400, tax and tip included. Rated them 3.5 stars, -1 star for bad service, +0.5 star for trying to make it up to us with dessert. Doesn't absolve the fact, though...

Final Verdict: Food was fairly good and came out at a decent pace, we had a good time despite the manager's mean face. It was rude of him to complain about our party being late, bad service will surely seal your Yelp review fate...
author: Dana F.

description: We eat here almost every Tuesday afternoon. We use to eat at Golden Mountain in Chinatown but ever since we moved to the sunset, we've been getting dim sum here. The food is ok and the service is good. Nice and close. I think their noodle dishes are better than their dim sum tho.
author: Gordon L.

description: This restaurant sucks!!!  I am never coming back here again!!!  I use to come here with my family (only 4 of us) for dinner  (spending $100-$150) every week.  Not because the food was great but because we were lazy and it was close by.  BUT NO MORE!  I rather drive further out than to put up with their shi**y customer service.   I was treated so badly that I made my family vow to never give them any business again.
author: L C.

description: I don't think they seat you unless you have more than 4 people. I went there with a group of 4 on a Saturday night. It was packed. They would not even let us wait for a table. So we left. (it wasn't a private party)They only had big round tables out. No small square ones.
author: Stan P.

description:
good authentic dim sum -- better than the stuff in chinatown downtown
kinda far away and a bit of a wait
prices $2.30-$3.60 for the usual suspects (total for 2 under $25 including tea)
some small dishes to large dishes $1.99-$5.00
many dumpling choices
interesting specials, i.e. pig blood on the menu
author: Rob C.

description:
*Review is for dinner service*

We made reservations, and upon arrival had to wait approximately 10 minutes for our table of 7.  Waiting outside in the cold was I found out, was nothing compared to the amount of time it took for the food to come to our table.  

Once food came, the first two dishes arrived one at a time.  Without the rice too!  We really should have waited, but we were so hungry from waiting so long that we basically scarfed down those two plates.  Eventually, the rest of the dishes came, thankfully all around the same time.  

I enjoyed every dish that I ate.  The prices are higher here, but you can easily tell that the food is of much higher quality.  Look at the crab/lobster tanks and compare it to any other similar restaurant in the Sunset.  They are actually alive (fresh), and you can tell when you eat it.  I must admit I have rather dull taste buds, but everyone else at the table agreed with me that the food was excellent here.

So in summation, this place makes some delicious Chinese food, but the service was excruciatingly slow.  But the food was so delicious!!
author: Jeff H.

description: i came here with friends for dim sum just cuz we wanted to, it was weird not with family cuz i never ordered for myself...always my parents. but we kinda know what we liked and wanted. the food is pretty satisfying, and close by if you're in the sunset. easy parking, nice waiter ppl and yup, we'd come again.
author: Christine M.

description: It was probably not a good idea to come here on Christmas for Dim Sum. We had to wait half an hour for seats, and the food took forever to come. The food was good though, but compared to other restaurants I've been to, the prices are kind of jacked up.
author: Alex Y.

description: We came here for a 40th Anniversary Dinner... it's not really set up for a banquet type dinner but they used a seperate room and it worked out pretty nice.  The food here is actually really good.  We had this crab that uses the salty egg to batter the crab, which I've never had, and that was pretty good and I don't even like the salty egg.  We also had a scallop and beef plate which I've never seen anyone else mix those two in one dish.  Everything was tasty and I was so full by the end of the night.
author: Kymberli C.

description: I just finished my dinner with my friends tonight. The food is o.k. The waitress was very mean and rough. No manner, impolite, the attitude was really bad. I never met a waitress like that. I will not be going to this restaurant again!
author: mei l.

description: Came here with a group of 8 friends for dim-sum on Sunday.  The place was packed.  We had reservations and were promptly seated.  The dim sum was really good! Everything tasted fresh and the ingredients were good.  Our waitress provided great service - she was warm and accomodating - this is not very common at most Chinese restaurants. We thought our beers weren't cold enough and she brought out an ice bucket.  And the prices are very reasonable - a fraction of Yank Sing and Tong Kiang.  And it's more authentic - none of that non-traditional BS stuff that Yank Sing offers in order to drive up the check.  This will be my new go to place for dim-sum.
author: Eric C.

description: Awesome dimsum and pretty cheap too.  The Chinese dinner here is really good as well.
author: Lily K.

description: simply some of the best dim sum ive ever had. shared it with friends and all five agreed! fresh and tasty.
author: M S.

description: Went on a weekday night for dinner with some friends.  I was the only white guy in the entire place, with three asian women and one asian guy at my table.  String bean chicken was mediocre at best.  The soy sauce chicken was excellent.  The girls said they love the place for the dim sum, which we didn't have.  They ordered an egg plate that looked like egg custard, they all seemed to think it wasn't very good (but they had seconds), but I didn't like it.  Their seafood noodle plate and eggplant dishes were excellent.  Seems like if you know what to order this place is a winner. Service was friendly and quick. The food was hot and our tea was strong.
author: David S.

description: Unlike many other neighborhood Chinese restaurants, this one has very nice people!
author: JC D.

description: this place can be better.. i always expect better but than i get the same outcome each time i come... i never come in the morning always at night. what i get here i can get 50% less up the block says my mother! but she likes to eat here, its kind of bland here, thats because i like seasoning! they have shark fin soup ..at every place but i like it here more .. maybe because its close to home. but i dont recall much so when i remember i'll continue!
author: Carolyn Y.

description: This place was pretty good when I was going here as a kid for family dinners but now the quality has downgraded. I get more grease and salt in my food than anything else. Service is good as is the atmosphere but the food aint so great.
author: Jason C. J.

description: This place is easily my most favorite Cantonese Chinese restaurant outside of Hong Kong or Vancouver.  Dinner or dim sum, the quality and the inventiveness is impeccable.  And, it's not snooty.  You can totally wear sweat pants.
author: K W.

description:
Okay, This place is pretty good.  They just renovated the restaurant so the restaurant is pretty clean.  The only time when Chinese restaurants are clean is 1-2 years after renovation.  After that, ALL Chinese restaurants go down hill.   

Food is decent too probably one of the best in San Francisco.  I would give it 5 stars if they had a little more selection for the more authentic stuff.  The only Dim Sum places that get 5 stars from me are the places in Hong Kong and maybe Koi Palace so consider this an excellent rating for a place in San Francisco.
author: Ethan C.

description:
Perfect place to stop by for some Yum Cha after sleeping in on a Sunday afternoon.  The little $1.99 section on the menu is great if you don't want to spend too much.. best things there are 1. salt and pepper fried tofu squares 2. pork lungs?  comes with an awesome spicy soy sauce on a bed of brussel sprouts.  The fried calamari may sound tempting for such a low price, but it's not that good.  I could hardly taste the calamari at all and it's always soggy.  Other things to try on the menu if this is your first time: Chiu Jou Fun Go (Chiu Jou dumplings with peanuts, chives, and meat inside.. mmmmmm SO GOOD), fried shrimp dumplings, Porteguese egg tarts, and your traditional Ha Gao (plain shrimp dumpings).  

Weekend afternoons are SUCH  a long wait.  Get here before 11:00am.  BUT if you're only looking to sit 2-3 people, you may be lucky and get to cut everyone in the line!!!
author: Connie P.

description: went back last night and had two more chef specials: the silver fish and lotus and the fried sticky rice in bamboo (those are probably not their actual names) and they actually dethroned the good frickin frog for the tastiest dishes. the kids LOVED the rice in the bamboo and ate it like they were just released from prison -- a sight only a chinese mother could love.
author: L. M.

description: Now THIS is real dim sum.  The food is AWESOME, the service is fast, the food comes out quick, and it's CHEAP.  I dare you to spend more than $20 for 2.
author: Helen K.

description: I come here to eat with my family once every other week and we're rarely disappointed. The waiters are typically attentive enough and if you're having problems just flag one down.  Only problem is if you're seated in the corner by the fish tank and nobody can really see if you want more tea unless they're going to get more chairs from the back. The food is great and the tastes are pretty consistent. I've only ever been disappointed by one dish there which was a bland steamed tofu with pickled vegetables type dish. Their dim sum is great, as most of the dishes on their menu.
author: Tiff L.

description: Went here only a few times, including last weekend.  We had the traditional banquet-style dishes and the food was absolutely amazing.  The shark fin soup with the bits of crab meat was delicious!  The prawns with the mayonnaise and walnuts were tasty as usual.   The catfish was pretty good too.  The roast pork and jellyfish were better than ones I've tasted in the past.  Basically, everything was exquisite (:
author: Jasmine T.

description:
Decided to check this place out as an alternative to Ton Kiang.  We were a party of 2, arrived at about noon on Sunday and ended up waiting about 35 minutes for a table.  At about 1:30 or so, they seemed to stop sending stuff out en masse so we had to ask for an order form so we could get the last few dishes we needed to finish off our meal.  It took us a while to figure this out since neither of us is Chinese, but once we did, it was fine.

The food quality was excellent - even better than Ton Kiang in my opinion.  Every dish was hot, seasoned well, and just plain solid.  In fact, I'm still thinking about how great each dish was.  We had:

bbq pork buns
sticky rice with chicken wrapped in leaves
shu mai
pan friend shrimp & chive dumplings
taro cake
beef rice noodles
shrimp rice noodles
shrimp dumplings
beef meatballs

Our tab was $30 for all that.   

I'd give it 5 stars for food quality, but gotta take off one on the overall review for service.  I have no problem with gruffness, but at least be efficient at the same time.
author: Michelle K.

description:
The best dim sum place I've tried in San Francisco.  The selection is really good here and the lobster noodle is a great deal at $18.  Additionally, the thickness and texture of the rice noodle is quite exceptional, and I really don't know any other restaurant that offers chicken and bitter melon rice noodle.  It's really yummy!

If the restaurant is packed, they have a convenient little door for to go orders.  You can order everything off the normal menu and everything is hot and fresh.
author: Sharon W.

description: best dim sum place in the city. great service, friendly staff, above average food, and very good prices. try the "salt and pepper tofu" dish. just awesome.
author: Tyler b.

description: My family enjoy going to S&T for dim sum and also for dinner; not only because the food is good, but service is good too.  Weekend dim sum hours usually full and requires maybe at least 20 minutes of wait time, longer for large parties.  Same for dinner on weekends.  But they do take reservations for dinner.   My favorite dish for dim sum besides the typical siu-mai and har-gow, I like their crab porridge and lobster lo-mein.  For dinner, I love their squabs.  It's better to ask them to hold however many squabs that you want, because they run out pretty quick.  The waiters are friendly, they like to joke and chat with guests whenever they come around to make sure everything is ok, and to pick up our plates.  It's the best place to go for Chinese food in the Sunset district.  Now I'm afraid more ppl are gonna go there to eat which will cause the wait for a table to be even longer  =)  But still, I highly recommend this restaurant.
author: Tadaa T.

description: I've have been here many times for dim sum, but after my last visit, I am for sure not going back. The food is OK here, but their service is awful. During a family lunch with 14 people, I asked for an extra setting for a late guest, and the waiter rudely responded that we should have eaten at home because we were "so troublesome." Then after our mean, the cashier lady simply dumped the bill on your table without looking. After spending a lot of money there for such a large group, I thought they would have wanted our repeat business. I guess not.  Although they have decent food, there are definitely better restaurants in the area that treat you with much much more respect.
author: fanny w.

description: they actually only get 3.5 stars but i'll just round up to 4.  actually no, i'm going to drop them back down to 3 since we had to wait 40 minutes for our freakin lotus leaf wrapped rice because they forgo our order.  we had to remind them 2 times so that's a total of asking for it 3 times before we were able to get it.  Nonetheless, S&T is probably the better din sum restaurants in the sunset district.  if you want better then just go to koi palace in daly city but be prepared to wait to get in.  There is a wait at S&T but not too bad.  The place is quite larde with two seperate rooms.  They do dinner service here also but I have yet to try that...it is quite full though everytime I drive by at night.   Also they've got another door outside if you just want to buy takeout.  I recommend getting takeout here instead of at the dim sum takeout shop up a block if you are looking for better quality.  So a good 3.5 star quality dimsum, but sorry I had to kock them down .5 stars for bad service...If they do better on my next visit, I'll write another review.
author: LittleBird 8.

description: Like I promised , I'm updating my review because I just tried their dim sum today . The shrimp rice noodle ( ha cherng ) was good . The rice noodle was really smooth ( probably the smoothest I've had so far ) which I really liked . The shrimp dumpling ( ha gow ) and shui mai was alright . The custard bun was pretty good .. the custard was pretty creamy . The soy sauce chow mein was pretty good too . The pan fried radish cake was ok but for some reason , it tasted a little weird too . The salt & pepper squid was ehhh ..  not much flavor . The shanghai dumplings weren't that good either . Had really little soup in them & not much flavor . I liked the fact that they had big clam jook because you don't see that in a lot of places but it wasn't good . The big clam is good but not the jook . Like my dad said , they probably just used a machine to grind up the rice to make the jook . I think so because the jook was very watery and not thick at all . You can't taste any small bits of rice at all . I didn't like the texture of the mango pudding .. it was too mushy . It wasn't firm enough probably because they didn't add the powder you're suppose to add to jellos and puddings to make it firm ( I'm not sure what it's called , sorry ) . Overall , I give them 3 stars for yum cha . If I average it out with my previous dinner experience , I would have to say this restaurant deserves 3.5 stars but since Yelp doesn't allow me to get half stars , I'll cut this place some slack and give this restaurant 4 stars because the food was on the better side =]
author: Eileen L.

description: Food and service is ok.  I frequent this place a lot and their quality is always standard.  Had a bad experience once but their waitstaff took care of it right away, so that made up for the problem.
author: Gina R.

description: Really good food consistently, but poor service! The hostess doesn't speak English (should this be part of their training in Asian restaurants?) and she gives up your table even if you call ahead.
author: Crystal V.
